DOC.brief_summary: This study assess effect QVA149 patient-reported dyspnea moderate severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) patient .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect QVA149 Patient Reported Dyspnea Moderate Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD )
DOC.detailed_description: This study use multi-center , randomize , blind , double-dummy placebo control , three-period crossover design assess effect daily QVA149 q.d vs. placebo tiotropium 18 Î¼g q.d . term patient report dyspnea assess Baseline Dyspnea Index ( BDI ) /Transient Dyspnea Index ( TDI ) ( SAC version ) patient moderate severe COPD .
DOC.criteria: Patients moderate severe stable chronic obstructive pulmonary disease Smoking history 10 pack year Postbronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume 1 second ( FEV1 ) 30 80 % Patients must able use computer mouse display mMRC grade > 2 Patients history long QT syndrome Patients Type I uncontrolled Type II diabetes Patients COPD exacerbation respiratory tract infection within 6 week prior screen Patients history asthma Patients pulmonary lobectomy , lung volume reduction surgery , lung transplantation Patients concomitant pulmonary disease Patients require long term oxygen therapy ( > 15 h day ) Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
